1.summary: The domains tested are simple and restricted, which may limit generalization to more complex concepts.
1.verbatim: The domains tested (colors and directions) are fairly simple and restricted to text representations. It's unclear if the findings would generalize to more complex grounded concepts.

2.summary: Lack of comparison to multimodal models makes it hard to assess the gap between text-only models and grounded models.
2.verbatim: There is no comparison to multimodal models trained on both text and perceptual data, to assess the gap between pure language models and grounded models.

3.summary: More analysis of why the largest model succeeds is needed to enhance explanatory power.
3.verbatim: More insight into what enables the largest model to succeed (e.g. analyzing its representations) would strengthen the explanatory power of the work.
